events.title: United States issues Open Door Circular during Boxer crisis period
events.summary: Secretary of State John Hay circulated a note emphasizing China's territorial and administrative integrity amid great-power intervention pressures.
events.impact: The move set a long-running U.S. baseline for China policy and strategic-commercial access in East Asia.

events.title: U.S. repeals Chinese Exclusion Act regime in wartime alliance context
events.summary: Congress repealed Chinese exclusion laws and created a small China immigration quota during World War II.
events.impact: The repeal removed a major diplomatic grievance and supported alignment with China against Japan.

events.title: People's Republic of China is proclaimed, reshaping bilateral alignment
events.summary: Mao Zedong announced the establishment of the PRC, ending mainland control by the ROC government.
events.impact: U.S.-PRC official ties were suspended for decades and the Taiwan-centered diplomatic framework hardened.

events.title: Korean War outbreak initiates period of direct U.S.-China military confrontation
events.summary: War on the Korean Peninsula rapidly drew in U.S.-led and Chinese forces, internationalizing Cold War conflict in Asia.
events.impact: Military hostility deepened and bilateral estrangement extended across security, trade, and diplomatic channels.

events.title: United States and ROC sign Mutual Defense Treaty
events.region: Taiwan Strait; United States; East Asia
events.summary: Washington and Taipei signed a treaty formalizing U.S. defense commitments in the Taiwan theater.
events.impact: The agreement entrenched strategic rivalry with Beijing and raised cross-strait escalation stakes.

events.title: Second Taiwan Strait crisis erupts with shelling of offshore islands
events.summary: PRC bombardment of ROC-held offshore islands resumed major cross-strait military confrontation.
events.impact: U.S.-China military risk intensified and crisis management became central to bilateral security policy.

events.title: Nixon announces planned visit to the PRC
events.summary: Following secret diplomacy, President Nixon publicly announced that he would visit China.
events.impact: The announcement marked a strategic break from two decades of isolation and opened a path to normalization.

events.title: UN General Assembly adopts Resolution 2758 on China's representation
events.summary: The General Assembly recognized the PRC's representatives in the United Nations framework.
events.impact: China's diplomatic position strengthened globally and the bilateral normalization trajectory accelerated.

events.title: Nixon arrives in Beijing for first U.S. presidential visit to PRC
events.summary: President Nixon began a landmark visit to mainland China and held high-level talks with Chinese leadership.
events.impact: The visit reset great-power alignment and created durable diplomatic channels after long estrangement.

events.title: Shanghai Communique is issued
events.summary: The United States and the PRC published a joint communique outlining principles for future relations, including Taiwan language.
events.impact: It established the core political framework that later enabled full diplomatic normalization.

events.title: Washington and Beijing announce normalization agreement
events.summary: Both governments announced they would establish formal diplomatic relations effective January 1, 1979.
events.impact: The announcement ended the non-recognition era and reset bilateral diplomatic architecture.

events.title: Formal diplomatic relations between the U.S. and PRC begin
events.summary: Official diplomatic relations entered into force and embassy-level relations were established.
events.impact: Bilateral engagement expanded across trade, science, and security while Taiwan issues remained contested.

events.title: Taiwan Relations Act is enacted in U.S. law
events.summary: Congress enacted the Taiwan Relations Act to govern unofficial ties and security commitments after recognition shifted to Beijing.
events.impact: The law became a central structural constraint and stabilizer in the triangular U.S.-PRC-Taiwan relationship.

events.title: U.S.-China August 17 Communique on Taiwan arms sales is issued
events.summary: Washington and Beijing announced a communique addressing U.S. arms sales to Taiwan and broader bilateral principles.
events.impact: It lowered immediate diplomatic friction but left long-run interpretive disputes embedded in the relationship.

events.title: Tiananmen crackdown causes major bilateral freeze
events.summary: Chinese military suppression of protests in Beijing triggered sharp U.S. political backlash and policy restrictions.
events.impact: High-level military and political ties were curtailed, introducing persistent human-rights friction into bilateral policy.

events.title: EP-3 aircraft collision near Hainan triggers acute bilateral crisis
events.region: South China Sea; China; United States
events.summary: A U.S. EP-3 reconnaissance aircraft collided with a Chinese fighter and made an emergency landing on Hainan Island.
events.impact: Crisis diplomacy intensified and military-operational risk management became a central bilateral issue.

events.title: China enters WTO, accelerating U.S.-China economic integration
events.summary: China became a WTO member, embedding its trade with the United States in a formal multilateral rules framework.
events.impact: Goods trade and supply-chain integration expanded rapidly, reshaping investment and industrial competition patterns.

events.title: First tranche of U.S. Section 301 tariffs on China takes effect
events.summary: The United States began collecting additional 25 percent tariffs on a first tranche of Chinese imports under Section 301.
events.impact: The tariff cycle formalized a new phase of strategic economic competition and broad repricing of bilateral trade risk.

events.title: U.S. and China sign Phase One trade agreement
events.summary: Both governments signed the Phase One agreement covering commitments on trade, IP, technology transfer, and enforcement mechanisms.
events.impact: Escalation paused temporarily, but structural rivalry in technology and industrial policy remained unresolved.

events.title: U.S. announces broad advanced-chip and semiconductor export controls to PRC
events.summary: BIS released major controls targeting advanced computing chips and semiconductor manufacturing capabilities linked to China.
events.impact: Technology competition shifted to systemic controls on compute supply chains, investment planning, and licensing risk.
